H0.text: Day is the interval about which a new moon occurs.

H1.text: Year is the approximate interval between successive new moons.

H2.text: Week is the approximate interval between new moons.

H3.text: Month is the interval after which a new moon occurs about every month.

A4.text: A lunation, or synodic month, is the period from one new moon to the next.

A5.text: The length of any one synodic month can vary from 29.26 to 29.80 days (12.96 hours) due to the perturbing effects of the Sun's gravity on the Moon's eccentric orbit.
